{{book |title=The Individuated Hobbit:
Jung, Tolkien, and the Archetypes of Middle-earth | image = individuated_hobbit.jpg |author=[[Timothy R. O'Neill]] |isbn=039528208X |publisher=[[Houghton Mifflin]] |date=September [[1979]] |format=Hardcover |pages= 200 }} '''''The Individuated Hobbit: Jung, Tolkien, and the Archetypes of Middle-earth''''' is a critical study of the works of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] by [[Timothy R. O'Neill]]. It was written from a Jungian perspective, with particular emphasis put on archetypes. ==Contents== * Preface ** I. Introduction: Theory ** II. Theory and Construct in Analytical Psychology ** III. Númenor lost: The Neurosis of Middle-earth ** IV. The Individuated Hobbit ** V. "Frodos Dreme" ** VI. White Lady, Dark Lord, Grey Pilgrim ** VII. Trickster, Tree and Terminal Man ** VIII. Númenor Regained: The Individuation of the West ** IX. Archetype and Allegory * Glossary of Key Terms * Bibliography * Index ==External links== * {{WP|The Individuated Hobbit}} * ''[https://archive.org/details/individuatedhobb00onei The Individuated Hobbit]'' at the ''Internet Archive'' (available to borrow for free) {{title|italics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Individuated Hobbit, The}} [[Category:Publications by title]] [[Category:Scholarly books]]
